intro: Nemcia crenulata, commonly known as the serrated nemcia, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its opposite, serrated leaves and clusters of small, fragrant white flowers. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for study in ecological and horticultural contexts.
